summary: This is an email chain from June 29, 2020, regarding an attempt to open a subpoena related to Epstein. The message indicates technical issues accessing the subpoena and involves American Express Global Security's New York office. It appears to be a secure communication from the Department of Justice.

persons.name: Director/Investigations American Express Global Security
persons.context: The recipient of the email at American Express Global Security's New York office, involved in receiving a subpoena related to Epstein.

events.title: Email regarding Epstein subpoena access issue
events.description: An email was sent regarding technical difficulties opening a subpoena related to Epstein, with a secure message from the Department of Justice requiring access by a specific deadline.

events.title: Deadline to access secure DOJ message
events.description: The deadline by which the recipient must click to read the secure Department of Justice message regarding Epstein before it becomes inaccessible.

locations.description: American Express Global Security New York Office

keyFacts: The document is a June 29, 2020 email regarding technical issues accessing a subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The communication involves American Express Global Security's New York office and appears to be from the U.S. Department of Justice.
There is a secure message with a deadline of July 9, 2020, to access the content, indicating ongoing investigative or legal proceedings.
The email includes confidentiality disclaimers from both Proofpoint Encryption and American Express, highlighting the sensitive nature of the communication.
The document reference EFTA00068116 suggests it is part of a larger set of records, possibly related to financial investigations.
